Cell.Data: [Tips 1/14] Soldier of Fortune mode: Mandates\n\nIn this game mode you will have to work with the Host of the Purple Phoenix to handle Mandates and Expeditions as a bounty hunter. Talk to âDashingâ Eugene on the right of the screen, he will get you started on your first mandate and reward you upon quest completion.

[Tips 2/14] Core Combat Mechanics Weapon combos: There is a different attack combo per weapon type Melee-dash: Melee characters can automatically dash on a foe every 5s. Toggled via the HUD (F) Use skills: Up to 5 abilities can be and added to the skill bar (1, 2, 3, 4, and RIGHT CLICK)

[Tips 3/14] Health Management Health: If your health pool reaches 0 you are out of combat Potions: Use one of your two potions to help you in combat (Q W). Replenish them by killing foes Potion types: There are Health, Rage and Willpower potions

[Tips 4/14] Leveling up in Wolcen Basic progression: Each level grants you 1 of each attribute, max health and health regeneration Customize attributes: You earn 10 more points to distribute in the Character Sheet (C) Passive skills: And 1 passive point to spend in the Passive Skill Tree (P)

[Tips 5/14] Dodge Rolling Dodge roll: Allows you to evade dangerous attacks in the cursor direction (SPACE BAR) Stamina points: A roll consumes a stamina point. A character starts with 4 points Stamina regeneration: Stamina points regenerate quickly over time

[Tips 6/14] Resource Opposition System Resources: Spells consume Willpower while Attacks skills use Rage Opposition: When Willpower is used it is transferred over time to the Rage amount and vice-versa Transfer Time: Resources are unusable for a short time while they transfer

[Tips 7/14] New Combat Skills Loot new skills: Kill foes and loot items containing skills. They are called Enneracts Learning: In the inventory (I) use the Enneract to learn its skill (RIGHT CLICK on it) Buying skill levels: Sell them to Demetra and gain Primordial Affinity to level up your skills

[Tips 9/14] Status Ailments Damage types: All damage types except Physical have a chance to inflict an additional effect Status ailment chance: Increase the chances with the Wisdom attribute, passives and gear Status ailment resistance: Likewise, enemies can inflict these same effects on you

[Tips 12/14] Passive Skill Tree Class freedom: Create your own path starting from the center Points allocation: If you have points to spend, permanently select one node to gain its effect(s) Major nodes: These offer stronger effects that can change the game rules permanently. Try to fetch as many as possible [Tips 13/14] Rotating Circles Multiple starts: You are free to start back from the tree center and explore different paths simultaneously Rotate rings to create new paths: Click on a ring on the left panel and rotate it with arrows to reveal new possibilities Connected nodes: Eligible nodes must always be connected to the center or to an already chosen node. Non-eligible nodes that result from a ring rotation will be temporarily turned off until they are connected again

â¢ Strong enemies are immune to crowd-control effects such as <font color="#72c6db">Stun</font> or <font color="#72c6db">Freeze</font>. Instead, hits that should inflict these effects deplete their <font color="#72c6db">Break Bar</font>. Once their <font color="#72c6db">Break Bar</font> has been fully depleted, the enemy will be <font color="#72c6db">Broken</font> for a very short time, and take increased damage from all sources. Use that opportunity to inflict as much damage as you can!

RIGHT-CLICK the Enneract in your Inventory to learn a new Skill. â¢ You can trade Enneracts with Demetra for Primordial Affinity, which is used to level up Skills at her shop. â¢ Increasing the level of a Skill unlocks Skill Modifiers. Press S to open the Active Skills Menu. â¢ Skills can level up while being used in combat.

â¢ ZÃ­skal jsi Ennerakt, starobylÃ© magickÃ© zaÅÃ­zenÃ­. PRAVÃM KLIKEM myÅ¡i na Ennerakt ve tvÃ©m InventÃ¡Åi se nauÄÃ­Å¡ novou Dovednost. â¢ MÅ¯Å¾eÅ¡ smÄnit Ennerakty s Demetrou pro odemknutÃ­ ModifikÃ¡torÅ¯ DovednostÃ­. Stiksni S pro otevÅenÃ­ PÅehledu AktivnÃ­ch DovednostÃ­. â¢ Dovednostem se bÄhem boje s nepÅÃ¡teli zvyÅ¡uje jejich ÃºroveÅ.

â¢ <font color="#72c6db">Gems</font> are special items that, once socketed to another item, can add magical effects to it or your character. An item needs <font color="#72c6db">Sockets</font> for <font color="#72c6db">Gems</font> to be inserted into them. There are many <font color="#72c6db">Gem</font> types to discover, and each one has a different effect depending on the <font color="#72c6db">Socket</font> type it is inserted into.\n\nâ¢ To insert a <font color="#72c6db">Gem</font> into a <font color="#72c6db">Socket</font>, move the <font color="#72c6db">Gem</font> into the <font color="#72c6db">Socket</font>. You can buy <font color="#72c6db">Gems</font> from <font color="#72c6db">Zenefer Stark</font> in the Stormfall market, and she even can remove <font color="#72c6db">Gems</font> from their <font color="#72c6db">Socket</font> for a price.

â¢ <font color="#72c6db">Drahokamy</font> jsou speciÃ¡lnÃ­ pÅedmÄty, kterÃ© mohou bÃ½t vloÅ¾eny do posÃ¡zitelnÃ½ch pÅedmÄtÅ¯ a pÅidajÃ­ magickÃ½ ÃºÄinek tvÃ© postavÄ. PÅedmÄt musÃ­ mÃ­t <font color="#72c6db">MÃ­sto</font> na osÃ¡zenÃ­ <font color="#72c6db">Drahokamem</font>, kam se dÃ¡ vloÅ¾it. Existuje mnoho druhÅ¯ <font color="#72c6db">DrahokamÅ¯</font> kterÃ© mÅ¯Å¾eÅ¡ najÃ­t a kaÅ¾dÃ½ mÃ¡ jinÃ½ ÃºÄinek, zÃ¡visejÃ­cÃ­ na typu <font color="#72c6db">OsÃ¡zenÃ­</font>, kterÃ½ je moÅ¾nÃ© vloÅ¾it.\n\nâ¢ K vloÅ¾enÃ­ <font color="#72c6db">Drahokamu</font> do <font color="#72c6db">MÃ­sta k osÃ¡zenÃ­</font>, pÅesuÅ <font color="#72c6db">Drahokam</font> do <font color="#72c6db">PatÅiÄnÃ©ho mÃ­sta k osÃ¡zenÃ­</font>. MÅ¯Å¾eÅ¡ nakoupit <font color="#72c6db">Drahokamy</font> od <font color="#72c6db">Zenefera Starka</font> ve Stormfall obchodÄ. Dokonce mÅ¯Å¾e <font color="#72c6db">Drahokam</font> vyjmout z jeho <font color="#72c6db">OsÃ¡zenÃ©ho mÃ­sta</font> za menÅ¡Ã­ poplatek.

â¢ In her last moments, Mizzeonth fully unlocked the sleeping potential within you, allowing you to embody the <font color="#72c6db">Aspects</font> of Primordial beings.

â¢ Press <font color="#c5b14d">F</font> to open the Aspects of Apocalypse Selection window, then unlock the <font color="#72c6db">Aspect</font> you wish to use. Other <font color="#72c6db">Aspects</font> can be unlocked later in the game and can be switched at any time once unlocked.

â¢ Fill the <font color="#72c6db">Primordial Essence</font> meter by killing monsters. Once it is full enough, press <font color="#c5b14d">R</font> to transform. Your <font color="#72c6db">Primordial Essence</font> depletes over time, when you use skills or when taking hits. When it is fully depleted, you will transform back into your human form.

Use your <font color="#72c6db">Aspect</font> wisely, as it can help you out when overwhelmed by monsters.

â¢ BÄhem jejÃ­ch poslednÃ­ch okamÅ¾ikÅ¯, Mizzeonth fully unlocked the sleeping potential within you, allowing you to embody the <font color="#72c6db">Aspects</font> of Primordial beings.

â¢ Press <font color="#c5b14d">F</font> to open the Aspects of Apocalypse Selection window, then unlock the <font color="#72c6db">Aspect</font> you wish to use. Other <font color="#72c6db">Aspects</font> can be unlocked later in the game and can be switched at any time once unlocked.

â¢ Fill the <font color="#72c6db">Primordial Essence</font> meter by killing monsters. Once it is full enough, press <font color="#c5b14d">R</font> to transform. Your <font color="#72c6db">Primordial Essence</font> depletes over time, when you use skills or when taking hits. When it is fully depleted, you will transform back into your human form.

Use your <font color="#72c6db">Aspect</font> wisely, as it can help you out when overwhelmed by monsters.

â¢ All <font color="#72c6db">Attibutes</font> increase by one when you level up. You are given 10 <font color="#72c6db">Attribute Points</font> to assign freely with every level.

â¢ The 3 <font color="#72c6db">Attributes</font> with the most points increase your overall damage output.

â¢ You can reset your <font color="#72c6db">Attribute Points</font> and <font color="#72c6db">Passive Skill Points</font> using <font color="#efd373">Gold</font> and <font color="#8664aa">Primordial Affinity</font> respectively.</Data></Cell>

â¢ You are given 1 <font color="#72c6db">Passive Skill Points</font> each time you level up, up to a total of 89, and 2 additional points are unlockable through the Champion of Stormfall game mode. Assign your <font color="#72c6db">Points</font> and then <font color="#72c6db">Confirm</font> them.\n\nâ¢ You can turn the <font color="#72c6db">Gate of Fates</font> using the ring interface, allowing you to mix and match nodes freely.

â¢ This is the <font color="#72c6db">Active Skills Modifier</font> window. All of the <font color="#72c6db">Active Skills</font> you know are accessed here, where they can be dragged to any slot in your <font color="#72c6db">Skill Bar</font>.

â¢ You can also activate various <font color="#72c6db">Modifiers</font> for each <font color="#72c6db">Active Skill</font>, which will change or enhance their behavior, depending on their rank. Each <font color="#72c6db">Modifier</font> has an associated cost, so only a limited amount of them can be active at the same time. Up to 16 <font color="#72c6db">Modifiers</font> can be unlocked by increasing the <font color="#72c6db">Skill Level</font>.

â¢ It might even be possible to create copies of a skill so each can be modified differently...

â¢ Zanafer Stark, the <font color="#72c6db">Jeweler</font>, can remove any <font color="#72c6db">Gem</font> currently socketed to an Item, if you can pay the price.

She also sells <font color="#72c6db">Gems</font> too.

For the right price, she can even reroll the socket types of your items.

â¢ This is Demetraâs shop, also known as the <font color="#72c6db">Archivist</font>. She can take <font color="#8664aa">Primordial Affinity</font> you have harvested from Enneracts to increase the <font color="#72c6db">Level</font> of <font color="#72c6db">Active Skills</font> you have learned.\n\nâ¢ She can also sell you <font color="#72c6db">Enneracts</font> for <font color="#72c6db">Gold</font>.

â¢ This is your <font color="#72c6db">Inventory</font>. Any <font color="#72c6db">Item</font> you pick up will end up here. You can <font color="#c5b14d">LEFT-CLICK</font> on an item to move it, or <font color="#c5b14d">RIGHT-CLICK</font> to equip it. To discard an item to the ground, move the <font color="#72c6db">Item</font> outside of the <font color="#72c6db">Inventory</font> window.

â¢ You have just been given your first <font color="#72c6db">Ethereal Reagent</font>. These are used to make alterations to the current <font color="#72c6db">Magic Effects</font> on any items you may have. There are four different <font color="#72c6db">Reagents</font>, each having their own effect on the <font color="#72c6db">Magic Effect</font> of your items.

â¢ Each <font color="#72c6db">Reagent</font> comes in Normal and Legendary versions; Normal <font color="#72c6db">Reagents</font> can only be used on Rare or Magic items; Legendary <font color="#72c6db">Reagents</font> only on Legendary items.

â¢ To use a Reagent on an item, <font color="#c5b14d">RIGHT-CLICK</font> on the <font color="#72c6db">Reagent</font> you wish to use, and then <font color="#c5b14d">LEFT-CLICK</font> on the item of your choice to trigger its effect.
â¢ You have used your first <font color="#72c6db">Dye</font>. To use it on an armor piece, open the <font color="#72c6db">Cosmetic Inventory</font> by pressing <font color="#c5b14d">B</font>.

â¢ This is the <font color="#72c6db">Cosmetic Inventory</font>. Here, you can apply armor <font color="#72c6db">Dyes</font> that you have learned for a fee. To do that, select the <font color="#72c6db">âDyesâ</font> tab, select which armor section you want to dye on the right panel, and then select which colors you would like to apply to each <font color="#72c6db">Color Slot</font>.

â¢ You can also change the <font color="#72c6db">Skin</font> of any item you have equipped to the <font color="#72c6db">Skin</font> of another item. Available <font color="#72c6db">Skins</font> are listed on the left, under the <font color="#72c6db">âSkinsâ</font> tab. Any new item you pick up for the first time will be unlocked as a <font color="#72c6db">Skin</font> for all your characters, so pay attention!

â¢To open the <font color="#72c6db">Cosmetic Inventory</font> again, press <font color="#c5b14d">B</font>.

â¢ Welcome back to the <font color="#72c6db">Archivist</font> window. Now that one of your <font color="#72c6db">Skills</font> has reached the appropriate level, you can begin to create further duplicates of your <font color="#72c6db">Skills</font>. To duplicate a <font color="#72c6db">Skill</font>, simply open its leveling tab and click <font color="#72c6db">"Duplicate"</font> once you have the necessary resources.\n\nâ¢ Duplicating your <font color="#72c6db">Skills</font> allows you to assign different modifiers to each duplicate, allowing you to tailor each of your <font color="#72c6db">Skills</font> to deal with different kinds of scenarios. Note that each duplicate of a <font color="#72c6db">Skill</font> will level independently from the other duplicates you own.

<font color="#c5b14d">LEFT-CLICK</font> on an item to transfer it to your <font color="#72c6db">Inventory</font>. Open your <font color="#72c6db">Inventory</font> by pressing <font color="#c5b14d">I</font>.

â¢ <font color="#72c6db">Fast Travel</font> allows you to quickly travel to any <font color="#72c6db">Waypoint</font> that you have unlocked.\n\nâ¢ To <font color="#72c6db">Fast Travel</font> to an unlocked <font color="#72c6db">Waypoint</font>, enter the <font color="#72c6db">World Map</font> and click on the <font color="#72c6db">Waypoint</font> you wish to travel to. This will tranport you instantly to the other <font color="#72c6db">Waypoint</font>, but unlike the <font color="#72c6db">Town Portal</font>, using <font color="#72c6db">Fast Travel</font> will not leave a <font color="#72c6db">Portal</font> that allows you to return to your previous location.

â¢ Congratulations, you have completed all three acts of Wolcenâs campaign. The last 6 months since the events at the Conflux have been a blur, and now it seems that the noble houses of Stormfall have seen fit to appoint you the Regent of their city.\n\nâ¢ As Regent, you will manage the city of Stormfall and continue to grow your characterâs strength and abilities. To begin your duty, talk to <font color="#72c6db">Thunderblade Zalahir</font> or press <font color="#c5b14d">N</font> to open the <font color="#72c6db">Stormfall Overview Screen</font>.

â¢ Welcome to the <font color="#72c6db">Stormfall Overview Screen</font>. From here, you can access various <font color="#72c6db">Buildings</font>. Each <font color="#72c6db">Building</font> can unlock various gameplay features like a fifth skill slot, more personal stash tabs, your final <font color="#72c6db">Aspect of Apocalypse</font>, and more.

â¢ To access a <font color="#72c6db">Building</font>, simply click on its corresponding icon. Once within a <font color="#72c6db">Building</font> , you will need to launch a <font color="#72c6db">Construction Project</font> to unlock its functions. To help you understand what these functions are, each building has a <font color="#72c6db">Tutorial</font> that can be accessed by clicking the <font color="#72c6db">Question Mark</font> icon in the top right corner of each <font color="#72c6db">Building's</font> window.

â¢ At the moment, the <font color="#72c6db">Stormfall Palace</font> is already constructed, and you will need to complete <font color="#72c6db">Projects</font> there if you are to unlock the <font color="#72c6db">Construction Projects</font> of each <font color="#72c6db">Building</font>. Open the <font color="#72c6db">Stormfall Palace</font> window now by clicking on its icon.

â¢ This is <font color="#72c6db">Stormfall Palace</font>, your new home as Regent. From here, you can initiate <font color="#72c6db">Projects</font> that will increase the cityâs total <font color="#72c6db">Productivity</font>, as well as the number of <font color="#72c6db">Projects</font> you can have active at any one time. Every <font color="#72c6db">Project</font> needs a set amount of <font color="#72c6db">Productivity</font> to complete, so the more that is generated by Stormfall, the faster <font color="#72c6db">Projects</font> will be completed.\n\nâ¢ Certain <font color="#72c6db">Palace Projects</font> also need to be completed before you can initiate a <font color="#72c6db">Building Construction Project</font>. For example, the <font color="#72c6db">Seekers Garrison</font> requires you to invest in <font color="#72c6db">Training Facilities</font> before it can be constructed. Go ahead and select the <font color="#72c6db">Training Facilities Project</font>, and <font color="#c5b14d">LEFT-CLICK</font> âStart Projectâ to begin. Active <font color="#72c6db">Projects</font> will be listed on the top-left of the screen.

This is the <font color="#72c6db">Mandates Board</font>, where you can start exploring simple dungeons for loot. Once you have accepted a <font color="#72c6db">Mandate</font>, go through the portal to begin.

â¢ This is the <font color="#72c6db">Expeditions Map</font>. Here, you can accept quests to explore difficult dungeons for greater rewards. Once an <font color="#72c6db">Expedition</font> has started, you can only come back to Stormfall when reaching the end of a floor. Should you decide to continue, the dungeon will become more difficult, but the rewards will increase too.

â¢ You can further increase the difficulty and rewards by adding <font color="#72c6db">Area Modifiers</font>. Click <font color="#72c6db">âRoll Area Modifiersâ</font> to add them to the <font color="#72c6db">Expedition</font>. Add enough <font color="#72c6db">Area Modifiers</font>, and you may get the opportunity to lure powerful enemies for even better rewardsâ¦

â¢ Finally, if you have a <font color="#72c6db">Special Mission</font> item, use it here to access its destination.

Once youâve selected your difficulty level, accept the quest and go through the portal to begin.

â¢ Congratulations, you have completed your first <font color="#72c6db">Project</font>. Now that the <font color="#72c6db">Training Facilities</font> have been completed, you can begin the <font color="#72c6db">Construction Project</font> for the <font color="#72c6db">Seekers Garrison</font>. Or, if you would like to construct a different building, click on its icon and find out which <font color="#72c6db">Palace Project</font> needs to be completed, and then initiate that <font color="#72c6db">Project</font>.\n\nâ¢ Once you are happy with the <font color="#72c6db">Projects</font> you have initiated, complete an <font color="#72c6db">Activity</font> (<font color="#72c6db">Mandates</font> or <font color="#72c6db">Expeditions</font>) to end a <font color="#72c6db">Turn</font>, which will allocate your total <font color="#72c6db">Productivity</font> to each active <font color="#72c6db">Project</font>.

â¢ Welcome to the <font color="#72c6db">Seekers Garrison</font>. Here you can start unique <font color="#72c6db">Projects</font> called <font color="#72c6db">Seeker Expeditions</font>. <font color="#72c6db">Seeker Expeditions</font> send Seekers to different locations throughout the world of Wolcen. Each <font color="#72c6db">Seeker Expedition</font> has a different kind of reward attached to it, related to the environment the Seekers will be exploring.

â¢ Note that <font color="#72c6db">Seeker Expeditions</font> have a chance of failure. Some locations are harder to get to than others. Other locations require ships to get to, so you will need to build the <font color="#72c6db">Shipyard</font> before you can access those.

â¢ New <font color="#72c6db">Seeker Expeditions</font> are available each <font color="#72c6db">Turn</font>.

Have a look at your available <font color="#72c6db">Seeker Expeditions</font> now.

â¢ Welcome to the <font color="#72c6db">Trade Assembly</font>. Here can start unique <font color="#72c6db">Projects</font> called <font color="#72c6db">Diplomatic Missions</font>. These <font color="#72c6db">Missions</font> dispatch Diplomats to different societies and cultures scattered throughout Wolcen. Each <font color="#72c6db">Mission</font> has a different kind of reward attached to it, based on a key aspect of the culture your diplomats are visiting.

â¢ Keep in mind that <font color="#72c6db">Diplomatic Missions</font> have a chance of failure. Some places are more difficult to get to, increasing the chance of failure. Other locations require ships to get to, so you will need to build a <font color="#72c6db">Shipyard</font> before you can access those.

â¢ New <font color="#72c6db">Missions</font> are available each <font color="#72c6db">Turn</font>.

Take a look at your available <font color="#72c6db">Missions now</font>.

â¢ Welcome to the <font color="#72c6db">Dark Market</font>. Here, you can begin <font color="#72c6db">Projects</font> that will allow you to procure improved versions of the items in your possession, obtain <font color="#72c6db">Reagents</font>, and transform <font color="#72c6db">Reagents</font> into their legendary counterparts. In order to access these <font color="#72c6db">Projects</font>, you will first need to establish their corresponding <font color="#72c6db">Contact</font> in the <font color="#72c6db">Dark Market</font>.

â¢ Welcome to the <font color="#72c6db">Transmutation Forge</font>. Here you can carry out <font color="#72c6db">Transmutation Projects</font>; these <font color="#72c6db">Projects</font> allow you to take an item from your inventory and transmute it into a random item of the same category, quality, and rarity once the <font color="#72c6db">Project</font> has been completed.

â¢ This means that weapons will only transmute into another weapon, and not an armor part or accessory; the transmuted item will also not be of the same type as the item you placed in the forge. For example, a dagger would not become another dagger.

â¢ To begin transmuting an item, drag the item you wish to transmute into the <font color="#72c6db">"Insert Item"</font> slot and click <font color="#72c6db">"Start Project"</font>.
â¢ Welcome to the Diamond Bank. Here you can begin <font color="#72c6db">Projects</font> that will unlock additional tabs for your <font color="#72c6db">Stash</font>. .

â¢ Welcome to the <font color="#72c6db">Anankis Artifact</font> window. Here, you can begin a Project to recover an <font color="#72c6db">Artifact</font> discovered in Anankis. Doing so will unlock its power, giving you access to the final <font color="#72c6db">Aspect of Apocalypse</font> unlock.

â¢ Welcome to the <font color="#72c6db">Enneract Laboratory</font>. Here, you can unlock the feature that will allow Demetra to duplicate your <font color="#72c6db">Skills</font>. Completing the first <font color="#72c6db">Project</font> allows you to duplicate any <font color="#72c6db">Skill</font> once. In order to duplicate a <font color="#72c6db">Skill</font> a second time, you will have to upgrade the <font color="#72c6db">Enneract Laboratory</font>.

â¢ Welcome to the <font color="#72c6db">Siphon Chamber</font>. After a period of calibration, this device allows Demetra to siphon <font color="#8664aa">Primordial Affinity</font> from your body, and give you gold in return. Effectively, these <font color="#72c6db">Projects</font> allow you to convert <font color="#8664aa">Primoridal Affinity</font> into <font color="#72c6db">Gold</font>. \n\nSelect how much <font color="#8664aa">Primordial Affinity</font> you would like to convert into <font color="#72c6db">Gold</font>, and begin the <font color="#72c6db">Project</font> to initiate the conversion process.

â¢ Welcome to the <font color="#72c6db">Energy Instillator</font>. Once it has been calibrated, this device allows Demetra to transfer <font color="#8664aa">Primordial Affinity</font> into your body. The amount of <font color="#8664aa">Primordial Affinity</font> you receive is based upon how much <font color="#72c6db">Gold</font> you offer her - think of it as a way of converting your <font color="#72c6db">Gold</font> into <font color="#8664aa">Primordial Affinity</font>.\n\nâ¢ Simply determine how much <font color="#72c6db">Gold</font> you would like to convert into <font color="#8664aa">Primordial Affinity</font>, and begin the <font color="#72c6db">Project</font> to initiate the conversion process.

â¢ You will need to complete a <font color="#72c6db">Turn</font> before your <font color="#72c6db">Productivity</font> is allocated to the <font color="#72c6db">Project</font>. In order to complete a <font color="#72c6db">Turn</font>, you will first need to successfully complete an <font color="#72c6db">Activity</font> (<font color="#72c6db">Mandates</font> or <font color="#72c6db">Expeditions</font>). The harder the challenge, the more <font color="#72c6db">Productivity</font> will be added to your various <font color="#72c6db">Projects</font>. But fail, and the <font color="#72c6db">Turn</font> will not pass. \n\nâ¢ Go to the <font color="#72c6db">Mandates Board</font> or the <font color="#72c6db">Expeditions Map</font> now and select an <font color="#72c6db">Activity</font> to undertake.

<font color="#72c6db">Buildings</font> give access to various features through <font color="#72c6db">Projects</font>. You must first start the <font color="#72c6db">Construction Project</font> of a <font color="#72c6db">Building</font> before you can access its other <font color="#72c6db">Projects</font>.

Every <font color="#72c6db">Project</font> requires a set amount of <font color="#72c6db">Productivity</font> to be completed. At the end of every <font color="#72c6db">Turn</font>, Stormfall's <font color="#72c6db">Productivity</font> is allocated to each of your active <font color="#72c6db">Projects</font>.\n\nIncrease your base <font color="#72c6db">Productivity</font> by constructing <font color="#72c6db">Buildings</font> and completing <font color="#72c6db">Projects</font> in the <font color="#72c6db">Palace</font>.

You can see your active <font color="#72c6db">Projects</font> and their progression on the left.\n\nOnce a <font color="#72c6db">Project</font> has started, canceling it will not refund its base cost and you will have to start it over.
A Turn is completed when successfully finishing an <font color="#72c6db">Activity</font> from the <font color="#72c6db">Mandates Board</font> or the <font color="#72c6db">Expeditions Map</font>.

Complete a <font color="#72c6db">Mandate</font> from the <font color="#72c6db">Mandates Board</font> or an <font color="#72c6db">Expedition</font> from the <font color="#72c6db">Expeditions Map</font> to end the <font color="#72c6db">Turn</font>. The harder the challenge, the higher the <font color="#72c6db">Productivity</font> bonus is at the end of the <font color="#72c6db">Turn</font>, allowing you to complete <font color="#72c6db">Projects</font> faster.
